definition: according to/in accordance with/to shine/to illuminate/to reflect/to look at (one's reflection)/to take (a photo)/photo/as requested/as before
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
building/shop/term for certain service establishments/embassy or consulate/schoolroom (old)/CL:家[jia1]

sentences.english: Once he took us to be photographed with him in some big English photographic studio.
sentences.chinese: 有一次，他带我们到一个很大的英国照相馆里去照相。

sentences.english: Steven and Bill want to have a picture together and they intend to go to a photo studio.
sentences.chinese: 史蒂文和比尔想照张合影，他们打算去一家照相馆。

sentences.english: Others show the old photography studio name plates, valuable for the study of China's early photographic history, Huang says.
sentences.chinese: 照相馆馆铭对于研究中国早期摄影历史也颇有价值。

sentences.english: For years they owned a photo studio in town and put everything they made back into the business.
sentences.chinese: 他们经营一家照相馆多年，不断把赚的钱再投进去。

sentences.english: They got the pictures—but then had the film developed at a large camera store in downtown Buenos Aires.
sentences.chinese: 拿到照片后，又在城中心一家大照相馆把它冲洗出来。

sentences.english: I heard there is a popular photo gallery in this beach.
sentences.chinese: 我听说在这个海滩附近有一个很受欢迎的照相馆。

sentences.english: This photo studio applies new technology to make an instantaneous photograph possible.
sentences.chinese: 这家照相馆应用新技术使快照成为可能。

sentences.english: Later they went to the only photographer in town to have a picture taken.
sentences.chinese: 之后她们去了城里惟一一家照相馆拍下了一张照片。

definition: to enlarge color photos/color film processing
wedding photos (done in studio, kit and caboodle taken care of by the studio)
retail department/section of a retail store
